quest.name: Gulley of Woes
journal: Adalberta has a personal favor to ask of you.

Ever since losing to you in the latest contest, Wide Gulley has been taking on tasks like a man possessed. However, Adalberta suspects that more is driving him than simply the sting of defeat. Concerned for his health, she bids you speak with Wide Gulley in order to learn the truth of the matter.

Wide Gulley reveals to you that his father has been tampering with official records in order to enhance his standing in the guild. Deeply ashamed, he has taken on a throng of tasks in the hopes of turning Deep Canyon's lies into truths. Unfortunately, he has bitten off more than he can chew, and begs you to fulfill an order in his stead. Make your way to Camp Bronze Lake in upper La Noscea, and obtain twenty chunks of electrum ore on your guildmate's behalf.

You have delivered the electrum ore to a grateful Wide Gulley, who goes on to compare himself to brass─pretty to behold, but worth little. Will the man ever be able to meet the high expectations he has of himself?

※The next miner quest will be available from Adalberta upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Deliver chunks of electrum ore to Wide Gulley.

dialogue.name: ADALBERTA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I was hoping you'd come by. I need your help with something─it concerns Wide Gulley.

dialogue.name: ADALBERTA
dialogue.text: He's recovered from the wounds suffered in Coerthas and resumed his mining for the guild. Wonderful news, to be sure, but one thing yet troubles me.

dialogue.name: ADALBERTA
dialogue.text: You see, Wide Gulley has been taking on far more tasks than a single man should. Some attribute his newfound fervor to the sting of losing that ill-conceived jade contest, but I suspect there's more to the tale.

dialogue.name: ADALBERTA
dialogue.text: I tried to broach the subject with him, but he's as stubborn as an aurochs, insisting it's naught but my imagination. But I know there's something, and where I've failed, you might succeed. Strange though this may sound, you're the closest thing he has to a friend here.

dialogue.name: ADALBERTA
dialogue.text: So I beg you, Forename, speak with Wide Gulley and try to learn what ails him. Do what you can to ease his burdens.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Hmph, no doubt Adalberta sent you. She's been on me somethin' fierce since I came back. But it doesn't matter why you're here or at whose request. The simple truth is I need your help.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I've got a secret that would be sure to bring great shame on my family, but I need to tell someone, and I know that you're an honest sort.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Ledgers at the Concern have been tampered with, and I'm bein' credited for work I didn't do. Wasn't keen on believin' it, but the culprit is...my own father.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I first suspected somethin' was off when I received my last evaluation. I know better'n anyone what I do 'round here, and I knew I wasn't workin' that much.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I looked over the Concern's records of its dealin's with the guild, and, sure as day, I found some right damnin' evidence. Heh...didn't know whether to laugh or cry.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I never wanted it said that I had a leg up in the guild 'cause I'm the vice foreman's son. If I was to succeed, I wanted it to be by my own hands. Learnin' that my old man was falsifyin' my accomplishments was like a punch to the gut.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: An' that's why I've been workin' so feverishly of late. By fulfillin' enough orders, I'm hopin' to turn my father's lies into truths. But I've taken on more jobs than I've got hands to juggle 'em with.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: So, like I said, adventurer, I need your help. I'd say I'm swallowin' my pride to ask you this, but I've got no pride left. Whatever happens from here on out, I'm a miner first and foremost, and I just want to do my job.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Right now, the order givin' me the biggest headache is one for twenty chunks of electrum ore. You can find the stuff south of Camp Bronze Lake, over in upper La Noscea. Please hurry. And...thanks.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Have you got the twenty chunks of electrum ore yet? 'Case you've forgotten, you'll find them south of Camp Bronze Lake, over in upper La Noscea. Please hurry.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I couldn't have mined better ore myself. You've done me a great kindness.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Hm? Gratitude rolls queerly off my lips, does it? Mayhap that's something that comes more natural with time... 'Twas only my pride that held it back before, and as I said, I've naught of that left.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: I have to work harder than ever now to make my fictionalized accomplishments more'n just ink on parchment. As of now, I'm a fraud, plain an' simple. Not unlike this electrum, really. 'Tis impure stuff─gold mixed up with silver an' other metals...

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Bah, what am I sayin'? That comparison ain't fair to electrum. At least this alloy is worth somethin'.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: You see, when refined, electrum takes on an opulent whitish hue not seen in other metals. An' there're certain things that can't be made without it, so it's prized by crafters.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: No... No, if I'm to liken myself to any metal, it'd have to be common brass.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Stuff's pretty enough to look at when polished, but worth little and less.

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: Gah! I had dreams of bein' special─a one-of-a-kind type of miner everyone respected. But now...now I just...

dialogue.name: WIDEGULLEY
dialogue.text: ...Enough. Enough of this broodin'. I hate myself as it is─no need to add bein' a whiny sop to my list of failin's. You saved my hide today, Forename, an' I'll find a way to repay the debt. Mark my words.
